snippet: Hissène Habré, who is accused of the killing and torture of thousands of people in Chad in the 1980s, had evaded prosecution while living in Senegal.
abstract: Hissene Habre, former president of Chad, accused of killing and torture of thousands of opponents, is arrested in Dakar, Senegal; arrest is hailed as decisive step toward justice for victims of Habre's brutal 8-year reign in 1980s.
lead_paragraph: Hissène Habré, who is accused of the killing and torture of thousands of people in Chad in the 1980s, had evaded prosecution while living in Senegal.

headline.main: Senegal Detains Ex-President of Chad, Accused in the Deaths of Opponents
headline.print_headline: Senegal Detains Ex-President of Chad, Accused in the Deaths of Opponents
